page.title: 08MOULTON VILLAGE, GENERAL
page.content: Moulton used to be part of Rockingham forest. It had some hunting lodges. In Norman times the timber castle of John Fitzjohn (1296) stood on high ground northwest of the church. Today this is known as Castle Field and a spring still runs there. An ancient Manor House stood on the site of Manor Farmhouse. Moulton Grange is built on what was monastic farmland. There used to be four stone quarries in the area all supplying Northamptonshire sandstone and ironstone for building. The population of the village is about 4000 with the Parish of Moulton covering 2970 acres, situated within the District of Daventry. There are many village organisations, gardeners, history society, conservation, art etc, all giving the village it's true spirit.
